  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that a pallet had punctured the one metal 55 gallon drum of Dytek A amine (un2735) and had released 2 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023110060
item.description:
Report E-2023110060

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: TARRANT
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN EARTH SPECIALTY WASTE SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tanker had been picked up from a 3rd party tanker cleaning company. The investigation revealed that during the cleanout the 3rd party had removed the cleanout port cap on top of the tanker and didn't fully secure the cap once the tanker was cleaned out. The tanker was then sent to pickup a load at PPG Industries, the driver only checked the top hatch and hose valves after loading. Upon leaving the shipping facility the driver stopped at a scale 40 miles away, there was no evidence at this time of any release. Upon reaching his final destination he noticed material had sprayed out of the top of the tanker from the top of the tanker from the cleanout port. The cap was still affixed but he was able to hand tighten it. Based upon scale tickets from the beginning and end of his trip we were able to determine the amount that had released 45lbs = 5 gallons. The tanker showed signs of the material spraying onto the top portion of tanker.

item.title: Report X-2023101230
item.description:
Report X-2023101230

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: MUSCLE SHOALS
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel reported tank car GATX73831 leaking from the top of the car. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was found to be from the liquid valve blind flange. The leak resulted from a defective blind flange gasket and product leaking past the closed liquid line valve. A new blind flange gasket was installed and the leak stopped. The shipper was notified and is arranging for a certified mobile shop to replace the valve.
